column4: Hello. I just changed partition /dev/hda2 to an extended one: Now I want to activate swap space on the new /dev/hda5, but I get "No such file or directory" while `fdisk -l` shows me the correct partitions. How can I activate the new partition layout?
add the apropiate line to fstab
Yes, I changed hda2 to hda5 but on `swapon -a` I get the error msg "No such file or directory"
maybe you used upgrade instead dis-upgrade?? why did you not used the update manager??
I first used adpet which left a lot of broke pkgs. Then I made the final fix with aptitude.
can you paste the output of sudo cpufreq-info ??
during install is configured a swap partition but you can add one at any time in fstab
well the 2038 yeaqr problem is in al the system not just f-spot :)
I had no problems on that very same 32bit machine to alter the date with exiv2.
